document_data.name: Lapalgard
document_data.mainbody: '''Lapalgard''' was a large town in [[Lapaliiya]] in [[southwest Faerûn]] in the mid–14{{th}} century [[DR]]. It was based around the ancient stronghold known as the '''Fortress of Lapalgard'''.
document_data.Geography: It stood in the south of the realm, at the end of roads from [[Ithmong (Lapaliiya)|Ithmong]] and [[Lushpool]] via [[Dungar]], and faced the [[Dun Hills (Lapaliiya)|Dun Hills]] and the [[Bandit Wastes]].
document_data.History:
Facing attacks from [[yuan-ti]], in the aptly named [[-690 DR|Year of Fragile Beginnings, −690 DR]], the [[Lapal]] tribes united in the nation of Lapaliiya. Over the next ten years, they constructed the Fortress of Lapalgard and declared it a symbol of their unity and common cause.

The Fortress of Lapalgard stood strong for centuries, but no wars came to it after the fall of the [[Shoon Imperium]] in {{YearlinkName|450}}. Instead, a town grew around it, enriched by caravans passing between Lapaliiya and [[Halruaa]] through the [[Talath Pass]].
document_data.Government & Religion:
Lapalgard was led by the Knight-Commander of the Fortress.

The civic deity of Lapalgard was [[Tempus]].
document_data.Population: The town had a population of 3,701 in 1373 DR.
document_data.Activities: The soldiers of Lapalgard conducted patrols of the Bandit Wastes and the northeastern [[Mhair Jungles]] in equal measure.
